result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Jerome Cameron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court allows for transfer of probation to the state of Arizona

miscConds.notes:
*10/07/2022 Honorable Jeffrey A Wagner, Restitution is set at $2,482.63. Court orders defendant to pay restitution during probation. If not paid in full by the completion of probation, civil judgement to be enforced.*
Court ordered restitution for extradition charges from the state of Arizona. Amount to be determined at restitution hearing on October 7, 2022 at 08:15am.

Provide a DNA sample; pay the DNA surcharges. Court ordered defendant to pay victim assessment and surcharges. All costs, surcharges and assessment (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment.
- NO CONTACT with victim IH and the store.
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatments.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jerome Cameron

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Jerome Cameron in court.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Michael Jerome Cameron.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a restitution hearing. State filed a stipulation to which the defense does not object to the amount of restitution. Restitution is set at $2,482.63. Court orders defendant to pay restitution during probation. If not paid in full by the completion of probation, civil judgement to be enforced.
Received and Filed. Cameron Extradition Memo

Defendant Michael Jerome Cameron in court, in custody.  Attorney Jade K Hall in court for Michael Jerome Cameron.  Attorney Dennis Patrick Murphy in court for State of Wisconsin.  CASE IN BRANCH 38 FOR BRANCH 11. 
Defendant acknowledge the Amended Information.  Case proceeded to plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
As to Count 1 & Amended Count 2:
Defendant changes his/her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his/her plea, advised of his/her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his/her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions/elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing hearing proceeded with statements from state, defense and defendant.
As to Count 1:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 110 days time served.
As to Count 2:
The Court ordered the Defendant to 60 days in the House of Correction consecutive to Count 1 with zero days credit.
Court stated the sentences and placed the defendant on 18 months probation.  Court allows for transfer of probation to the state of Arizona
Conditions of probation are:
- no contact with victim IH and the store
- maintain work
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatments

Court ordered restitution for extradition charges from the state of Arizona.  Amount to be determined at the schedule restitution hearing in Branch 38.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.
Court ordered defendant pay victim assessment and surcharges.

All costs, surcharges and assessment  (including the DNA surcharges) to be paid by the end of probation, to convert to a civil judgment. 

Appeal rights given 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Restitution hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Letter from defendant.  (Michael J. Cameron - #341695, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (15 pages) commencing 08-01-22 by AMY DE LA ROSA.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5; all other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Michael Jerome Cameron in court with attorney Jade K Hall.  Defendant Michael Jerome Cameron in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Court hears arguments as to bail.  For reasons as set forth on the record, Court modifies bail to $2500.00.  All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to remain the same.  Defense requested a status conference date.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 11.  Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Jerome Cameron in court, appear by video with attorney Jade K Hall, appear by video.  Defendant Michael Jerome Cameron in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer M. Slomczewski.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to John Franke. Defense wants to be heard on bail.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Jerome Cameron not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State request the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or in the alternative status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Michael Jerome Cameron in court with attorney Maryann Corea.  Defendant Michael Jerome Cameron in custody.   Nate Mcclure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 2 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).
  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Case tabbed to Judge Kies in error

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K Warrant
